oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ESTIMATING LONG-TERM WAVE STATISTICS FROM LONG-TERM WIND STATISTICS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Liu, Paul C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave estimation
wave statistics
wind statistics
wind waves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Wave Climate Synthesis method, which derives long-term wave statistics from long-term wind statistics directly, is tested with four years of wind and wave measurements recorded from eight NOMAD buoys in the Great Lakes during 1981-1984. The results show that it is an excellent method for estimating long-term wave statistics and design wave height. While the method is by no means intended to replace wave hindcasting procedures, it is shown to be a useful additional tool for the coastal engineer.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 20 (1986): Proceedings of 20th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Taipei, Taiwan, 1986.; 39
